Title: US tightens sanctions on Russia to include Portovaya and Vysotsk LNG plants
Description: The Biden-Harris administration slapped more sanctions targeting Russian energy exports, including the small-scale Vysotsk and Portovaya LNG plants, with just over a week until President Donald Trump starts his term as president.
Author: JS

Title: UK cold snap dents gas stocks to “concerningly low levels”: Centrica
Description: UK energy firm Centrica stated that the recent cold snap has put significant pressure on the UK’s gas storage, prompting the company to seek an exemption to proceed with expanding the capacity of its Rough storage facility.
Author: JS

Title: Germany’s DET pushes second Wilhelmshaven FSRU commissioning to Q1 2025
Description: Germany's state-owned LNG terminal operator Deutsche Energy Terminal (DET) has postponed the commissioning of the Excelsior floating storage regasification unit (FSRU) to the first quarter of 2025.
Author: JS

Title: Bahrain’s BAPCO stages return to LNG market as it issues LNG purchase tender
Description: Bahrain’s BAPCO has issued an LNG purchase tender for supplies between 2025 and 2027, signalling the country’s return to the LNG market as an importer after a six-year hiatus.
Author: JS

Title: H-Energy seeks FSRU for Jaigarh LNG, eyes October-February 2026 delivery
Description: Mumbai-based real estate and infrastructure firm H-Energy has issued a request for quotations for a floating storage regasification unit for its delayed Jaigarh LNG import terminal in Ratnagiri in India’s western state of Maharashtra.
Author: CK

Title: China’s December LNG imports rise; 2024 volumes solidify top importer status
Description: China’s LNG imports rose sharply in December, driven by stock building for the winter season. The month-on-month increase contributed to an overall rise in 2024 imports, reaffirming China’s status as the world’s largest LNG importer for the second consecutive year.
Author: CK

Title: Dutch gas storage decline poses no immediate supply risk: Gasunie
Description: Gas storage levels in the Netherlands have fallen to lower-than-usual levels but do not currently threaten natural gas supply security, according to the Netherlands’ energy network operator Gasunie Transport Services.
Author: CK

Title: Chevron plans June to July maintenance at Gorgon LNG plant
Description: Chevron has scheduled a 35-day maintenance period at its 15.6 mtpa Gorgon LNG facility in Western Australia, with production from "greater than one half of an LNG train but not greater than one LNG train" set to be offline from June 1 to July 5, according to a notice on its website.
Author: CK
